text:
- Welcome to the network, API
booth here in the AWS Atrium.

To kick things off, the first
thing we'll do is jump into
the NIC demo.
So, what Nic has done here in partnership

with Deutsche Telecom and AWS
has built this drone use case

or this drone product for
emergencies, essentially,

you know, search and rescue
use cases, emergency response,
public safety surveillance.
And so in doing this, you know, there's,

there's been several challenges
that NIK has faced that need
to be accomplished by network APIs.

So the first one being,
you know, there's a lot
of regulatory requirements around drones
and where they're allowed to fly.
The second one being congested networks
and how you can connect to those networks.

And the third one being, you
know, identifying exactly

where devices are, drones
are at any given time.

So, to answer this, it,
with the combination

of AWS technology using
traditional A IML, iot core

and EKS, we've partnered with
Deutsche Telecom to be able
to incorporate these network APIs into the
drone use case.

So these are the three
network APIs that are,
are heavily featured within this product.
The first one being population density.

So to address the issue around,
you know, if there's a lot

of people in a given area,
drone regulations require that,

you know, drones, drones
take a, a path that
of less density.

So finding, finding an area
where there's less population,
allowing for the drones to smartly route
around heavily dense areas.
The second one being quality on demand.

So, you know, talking
about congested channels,
the quality on demand
or Q-O-D-A-P-I allows for the drone

to have prioritised
access into the network
that doesn't have to go
through the typical congested channels

that the average user
would have to go through,

enabling a more consistent
experience on the network
and the final one device location.
So, you know, in the, in the case

where there's location
spoofing or GPS spoofing

or onboard GPS sensors go
down on the drone, being able

to use the device
location API allows for us

to triangulate exactly the
drone's location using radio
towers in the given vicinity of the drone.
Thank you for stopping by.
